body: The form sought for centuries byI've drifted somewhat from the distant heartClear-voiced despite its years, strong, eloquentAgainst this sky no longer of our world.Archangel Winter, darkness on his backAt the white place of the road's vanishingIn Winter Haven, the ballplayers are stretchingIn the sound of the snow. What the countlessDreaming time has reversed, I watch drowned snowLucky the bellstill full and deep of throat,Green lilac buds appear that won't surviveWhat? What can you do?the old men burnish stories of Yaz and the BabePalladio who beckons from the other shore,Glimmering of light:The mortal architect had brought to life,Between the high and the low, in this night.The winged winds, captives of that age-old foeIn a single floral stroke,
